alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 26 at 2:16AM MST until January 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. Areas of blowing snow with visibility reduced to under a half mile at times. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 8 AM Thursday to 8 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds may be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Areas of blowing snow creating slick roads and poor visibility.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. Use caution if you must drive.
